entry.title: Event kicks off Habitat for Humanity housing project in Riddle
entry.summary: RIDDLE — As Brandy Blankenship walked up a dusty dirt slope, surveying the land that will make her a first-time homeowner, she didn’t stop smiling.

entry.title: YMCA of Douglas County launches summer programs
entry.summary: As summer break begins, parents throughout Douglas County are looking for opportunities to keep their children active, safe and socially engaged. Research shows that many children experience a significant decline in both academic skills and physical activity during the summer…

entry.title: BLM to hold prescribed fire near Glide
entry.summary: GLIDE — The Bureau of Land Management, Roseburg District, has announced a 122-acre prescribed burn within the North Umpqua Management Area, approximately 6 miles west of Glide off North Bank Road.

entry.title: Central Douglas received high-tech water rescue equipment
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Oregon Department of Emergency Management (OEM) has announced the delivery of advanced water rescue equipment to two Oregon communities as part of the State Preparedness and Incident Response Equipment grant program.

entry.title: June 16, 2025
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: BLM PREPARES FOR PRESCRIBED FIRE NEAR GLIDE
entry.summary: June 16, 2025 3:50 a.m. The Bureau of Land Management, Roseburg District, is preparing for a 122-acre prescribed burn within the North Umpqua Management Area, approximately six miles west of Glide off North Bank Road. A BLM release said fire ignitions may begin as early as Monday, if conditions are favorable. Local systems may be...

entry.title: SPECIAL DISTRICTS ELECTION HAS BEEN CERTIFIED
entry.summary: June 16, 2025 3:40 a.m. The 2025 Douglas County May Special Districts Election has been certified. Douglas County Clerk Daniel Loomis told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that this year’s voter turnout rate of just over 14.5 percent was the lowest voter participation rate in the last 20 years. The certified results, including...

entry.title: REEDSPORT MAIN STREET GRANT IMPACTS 8 PROJECT SITES
entry.summary: June 16, 3:30 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The City of Reedsport Main Street Program has received a $400,000 grant from Oregon Heritage, a division of the Oregon Parks and Recreation Department. Oregon Heritage has awarded 35 matching grants worth over $10.6 million to Oregon Main Street Network organizations across the state for building projects...

entry.title: SOURCE ONE SERENITY WITH SUMMER TRAIL STEWARDSHIP PROJECTS
entry.summary: June 16, 2025 3:05 a.m. This summer Source One Serenity invites veterans, their families, and the wider community to join a series of hands-on trail stewardship projects in the Umpqua National Forest. A release said the efforts will offer more than just trail maintenance. They will be opportunities to build community, preserve public lands, and...

entry.title: TIMBER OPERATORS TO HEAR ABOUT WOOD PRODUCTS AUTOMATION
entry.summary: June 16, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Douglas Timber Operators will have their next meeting on Thursday, June 26th. Con-Vey CEO Dave Larecy will have a presentation titled, Wood Products Automation – Built in Roseburg, Oregon”.
